result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Myron A. Blair

records.addlTxt:
11:26 AM Defendant Myron A. BLAIR in court.  Attorney Eric R Pangburn in court for Myron A. BLAIR.  Prosecuting attorney Anthony A. Lambrecht appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
State moves to dismiss and read in this file as part of the plea agreement with 21CF689 and 21CF62.  Motion granted.
Preliminary hearing on October 7, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on August 11, 2022 at 11:30 am.

Defendant demands a preliminary hearing and waives the statutory time period within which a preliminary hearing must be held.   Preliminary hearing is set for 08-11-22 at 1:30 p.m.   Bail is set at $500.00 recognizance bond with the condition that defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.   Bail furnished.   
Minutes.

RE:  Possess Fentanyl, on 11-24-19.
Initial appearance is set for 07-18-22 at 1:30 p.m. Br. 1
